alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... Peer review does not reduce the program directors to nonprofessional poll takers: The program directors select the reviewers, decide whose advice to follow in light of the goals of the programs they manage, and monitor the work of the scientists they fund.  The program directors are the gatekeepers at the money bin and therefore loom as important figures for researchers, who if not worried about getting a grant, are worried about renewing one. Physicists hoping for National Science Foundation support, for example, are told that 'while the advice of all reviewers is taken quite seriously, the final decision for funding is made by the Director and Staff of the Physics Division.'"
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Academic Whistleblower Jeff Schmidt on Peer Review: Peer Review Does Not Reduce Program Directors to Nonprofessional Poll Takers - Part 2
